review: I like the idea and as far as YouTube or Chrome Tabs are concerned, this device does what it is supposed to do. I'm living in Germany, and despite having a Netflix account and being able to route my internet traffic through the U.S., you cannot get it playing nicely with this setup out of the box without hacking your router. After a lot of internet research I found out it has to to tiwth the fact that Google is routing any Chromcast traffic across its own DNS servers (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4.) and the user has no option to change that.For now, I am happy with my Chromecast being a "YouTube stick" only - that's much less painless than starting YouTube on my Multimedia PC which is attached to the TV set, although I am not shure if it's worth its price, then.If it could replace the Multimedia PC, though, it would be perfect. That is: Playing local media, Spotify, Netflix outside the U.S. etc.
